;;参议员拉方扎·巴特勒于 2023 年 10 月 3 日在卡马拉·哈里斯的带领下在美国国会大厦宣誓就职。
;

;在国会山一个独特的历史性时刻，前工会领袖和民主党战略家拉丰扎·巴特勒 (Laphonza Butler) 在;卡马拉·哈里斯;周二成为参议院最新成员，取代加州参议员;黛安·范斯坦;上周去世后，成为历史上第三位黑人女参议员。

;

;巴特勒，44 岁，;被任命;周日，加州州长加文·纽森 (Gavin Newsom)，距离范斯坦 ;在家中去世仅两天后; 在华盛顿特区。巴特勒是加州民主党圈子的长期筹款人和战略家，是;艾米丽名单的负责人;，这是一个为支持堕胎权的女性候选人筹集资金的全国性组织。

;

;巴特勒在美国副总统的陪同下在参议院宣誓就职。曾是美国历史上第二位黑人女性参议员，直到 2021 年辞职，此前她曾是民主党人乔·拜登 (JoeBiden) 的竞选搭档，担任副总统。 news/2020/dec/14/electoral-college-joe-biden-donald-trump-2020-election">;2020 年竞选活动取得成功;。第一位担任美国参议员的黑人女性是来自伊利诺伊州的民主党人;卡罗尔·莫斯利·布劳恩; 20世纪90年代。

;

;国会黑人核心小组（CBC）也为巴特勒举行了宣誓就职仪式，许多成员拥抱了她。内华达州 CBC 主席史蒂文·霍斯福德 (Steven Horsford) 在一份声明中表示：“她的背景和多年的经验将为参议院带来急需的视角，目前参议院还没有黑人女性。”在国会山看到美国第一位女性副总统哈里斯在她的黑人同胞开拓者宣誓时笑容满面。巴特勒也是第一位公开的女同性恋黑人美国参议员。她的妻子 Neneki Lee 是服务业雇员国际工会 (SEIU) 公共服务部主任，她拿着一本圣经，巴特勒把手放在上面，进行正式宣誓。

;

;尽管巴特勒从未参加过选举在办公室，纽瑟姆称赞她对立法程序的“深入了解”，并称她是“唯一的选择”。

;

;尽管;当他决定任命一名“看守人”担任该席位时对他的批评;为了不让 2024 年竞选的局势发生倾斜，范斯坦表示将辞职，加利福尼亚州代表凯蒂·波特、亚当·希夫和芭芭拉·李宣布自己为候选人，而李得到了 CBC 的支持。巴特勒将不得不相对较快地决定是否参加竞选并竞选以保住席位。

;

; Wed, 04 Oct 2023 05:52:01 +0800 Video of ultra-Orthodox Jews spitting by Christians in Jerusalem sparks outragehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/03/video-of-ultra-orthodox-jews-spitting-by-christians-in-jerusalem-sparks-outrage
;;2023-10-03T21:41:11Z;
;
;;圣墓教堂。耶路撒冷。以色列
;

;一段视频显示，在圣城耶路撒冷，极端正统的犹太人在一群背着木制十字架的外国基督教信徒旁边吐痰，这在圣地引发了强烈的愤怒和一阵谴责。

;

;吐痰事件，该市少数基督教社区哀叹这是;出于宗教动机的袭击激增令人震惊;，周二引起了以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡和其他高级人物的罕见愤怒。<自以色列历史上最保守的政府去年年底上台以来，宗教领袖 — — 包括颇具影响力的梵蒂冈任命的拉丁宗主教 — — 对该地区拥有 2000 年历史的基督教社区日益受到骚扰表示担忧.

;
;

;;相关：;;圣地族长表示，基督徒在以色列政府统治下处于危险之中;

;
;

;许多人说政府及其财政部长 Bezalel Smotrich 和国家安全部长 Itamar Ben-Gvir 等强大的极端民族主义成员助长了犹太极端分子的气焰，并营造了一种有罪不罚的感觉。

; ;

;“右翼宗教民族主义所发生的事情是，犹太人的身份一直围绕着反基督教而增长，”基督教专家、以色列反基督教攻击热线创始人伊斯卡·哈拉尼(Yisca Harani)说。 “即使政府不鼓励这样做，他们也暗示不会实施制裁。”

;

;这些对不宽容现象加剧的担忧似乎违反了以色列对礼拜自由和对圣地的神圣信任的承诺，载入 75 年前纪念其成立的宣言中。以色列在 1967 年的战争中占领了东耶路撒冷，后来以未得到国际承认的举动将其吞并。

;

;如今耶路撒冷大约有 15,000 名基督徒，其中大多数是巴勒斯坦人，他们认为自己生活在占领之下。

;

; >;

;内塔尼亚胡办公室周二坚称，以色列“完全致力于捍卫所有信仰的圣地礼拜和朝圣的神圣权利”。

;

;“我强烈谴责任何恐吓礼拜者的企图，我致力于立即采取果断行动，”他说。

; ;

;随地吐痰的场景，;周一由以色列左倾报纸《国土报》的记者拍摄;，显示一群外国朝圣者开始游行穿过老城的石灰岩迷宫，这里是犹太教最神圣的地方、伊斯兰教第三圣地和主要基督教遗址的所在地。

;

;举起一个巨大的木制十字架，男男女女们沿着老城的路线返回。他们相信耶稣基督在被钉十字架之前所走的路线。一路上，身穿深色西装、头戴宽边黑帽的极端正统犹太人穿过狭窄的小巷，挤过朝圣者，手里拿着他们为为期一周的犹太住棚节节日准备的棕榈叶。当他们经过时，至少有七名极端正统派犹太人向基督徒旅游团旁边的地上吐口水。

;
;

;;相关：;;橄榄山成为争夺耶路撒冷控制权的最新目标< /a>;

;
;

;进一步加剧了愤怒，极端民族主义定居者领袖、内塔尼亚胡执政联盟议员的前顾问伊莱沙·耶里德 (Elisha Yered) 为吐痰者辩护，认为向基督教神职人员吐口水是对基督教神职人员吐口水的行为。教堂是一种“古老的犹太习俗”。

;

;“也许在西方文化的影响下，我们已经有些忘记了基督教是什么，”他在 X（以前称为 Twitter）上写道。 “我认为数百万因十字军东征而流亡的犹太人……永远不会忘记。”

;

;Yered 涉嫌参与杀害一名 19 岁巴勒斯坦人，目前仍被软禁。

;

;Yered 涉嫌参与杀害一名 19 岁巴勒斯坦人。虽然这段视频和耶里德的评论在社交媒体上像野火一样传播，但谴责的声音却越来越大。以色列外交部长伊莱·科恩 (Eli Cohen) 表示，向基督徒吐口水“并不代表犹太价值观”。

;

;该国宗教事务部长、极端正统派沙斯党 (Shas party) 成员迈克尔·马尔基利 (Michael Malkieli) 认为，向基督徒吐口水是一种行为。 “不是托拉之道”。以色列的一位首席拉比坚称随地吐痰与犹太法律无关。

;

;每天记录圣地基督徒袭击事件的活动人士对政府突然关注的浪潮感到惊讶。

;

;“今年针对基督徒的袭击增加了 100%，不仅仅是吐口水，还有投掷石块和破坏标牌，”哈拉尼说。 “对不起，”她对以色列当局说道。 “但是你在哪里？”

; Wed, 04 Oct 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Portugal to scrap ‘unjust’ tax breaks for foreign residentshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/03/portugal-to-scrap-unjust-tax-breaks-for-foreign-residents
;;2023-10-03T17:17:59Z;
;
;;街头人群举着横幅和标语牌
;

;葡萄牙的外国居民的税收减免“没有”总理安东尼奥·科斯塔 (Antonio Costa) 宣称，“不再合理”，并承诺在 2024 年停止新申请人计划，因为该计划推高了西欧最贫穷国家之一的房价。

;

;该计划于 2009 年启动，允许每年在该国居住超过 183 天而成为葡萄牙居民的人，对来自“高附加值活动”（例如医生和大学教师）的葡萄牙来源收入享受 20% 的特殊税率。;

;该计划的推出是为了吸引投资者和专业人士，因为葡萄牙遭受了金融危机。

;

;该计划的其他好处（称为非惯常居民）包括几乎所有外国收入的免税，如果在原籍国征税，对来自外国的养老金实行 10% 的统一税率。

;
;

;;相关：;;随着租赁市场变得“疯狂”，葡萄牙吸引外资的努力适得其反”;

;
;

;在国外居住五年或以上的葡萄牙公民也可以申请。

;

;科斯塔周一晚间告诉 CNN 葡萄牙频道，该计划“夸大了科斯塔补充道，“这不再有意义”，并解释说那些已经从中受益的人将继续这样做。< /p>;

;这一消息发布两天前，数千人走上里斯本和葡萄牙其他城市的街头，抗议因中产阶级化和旅游业创纪录而引发的租金和房价飙升。

;

;政府数据显示，去年超过 50% 的工人月收入低于 1,000 欧元（866 英镑），自 2015 年旅游业繁荣开始以来，里斯本租金上涨了 65%，导致许多人买不起公寓。

;

;根据住房数据专家 Confidential Imobiliário 的数据，这段时期内房屋售价上涨了 137%。

;

;批评者称，政府今年早些时候宣布的措施包括限制 Airbnb 短期租金和变更该国的黄金签证计划还不足以缓解这场危机，经济适用房的长期短缺也加剧了这场危机。

; Wed, 04 Oct 2023 02:22:02 +0800 Former pupils demand apology from Irish school over Nazi teacher’s bullyinghttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/03/former-pupils-demand-apology-from-irish-school-over-nazi-teachers-bullying
;;2023-10-03T17:54:33Z;
;
;;Louis Feutren 穿着绿色毛衣站在房子前面
;

;从来没有任何神秘感关于都柏林南部圣康莱斯学校的法语老师路易斯·费特伦 (Louis Feutren) 是纳粹合作者这一事实。

;

;他喜欢暴力惩罚和怪异羞辱，让学生感到恐惧。他喜欢回忆第二次世界大战，当时他加入了一个与德国并肩作战的布列塔尼民族主义团体。他还展示了自己穿着制服的照片。

;

;圣康莱斯医院接受了一名著名的纳粹合作者和法国司法逃犯的工作人员，该医院从 1957 年一直雇用费特伦，直到他 1985 年退休。直至 2009 年去世，作为一名教育家，他一直受到尊重和欢迎。

;

;然而，现在，遭受并目睹 Feutren 袭击的前学生要求学校管理委员会道歉。

;

; >;;Uki Goñi;，一位 1968 年至 1971 年间就读于圣康莱斯学院的作家，推出了该活动旨在揭露这名教师以及为他的历史和行为开脱的文化。 “我到达那里的第一天就知道他是纳粹分子。这只是正常化，”他周二表示。

;

;在给董事会的一封信中，Goñi 是一名为《卫报》撰稿的记者，并撰写了有关 ;纳粹向拉丁美洲“拉线”;，要求董事会成员为其前任的行为道歉。他在信中写道：“我们不能因为前辈的行为而受到评判，但这并不能免除我们今天与过去的距离。”信中还包括其他前任学生的证词。

; <戈尼表示，董事会将在周二举行的会议上讨论他的请求。该学校没有回应置评请求。

;

;Feutren 是布列塔尼运动 Bezen Perrot 的成员，该运动在法国占领期间与纳粹合作，希望建立一个独立的布列塔尼国家。该部队穿着党卫队制服，守卫着雷恩的一个审讯中心。费特伦是一名下级军官，军衔为上尉。戈尼说，战后，整个部队因针对犹太人和抵抗战士的罪行被判处死刑。

;

;Feutren 逃到威尔士，然后 ;爱尔兰;，他在戈尔韦大学学习，之后在都柏林南部鲍尔斯布里奇的一所著名学校圣康莱斯学校担任法语教师。

;

;“他们说他并不是真正的纳粹分子，而是布列塔尼分离主义者，”戈尼说。 “我的反应是，是的，但许多布列塔尼分离主义者并没有加入党卫军。”

;

;教职员工和学生都了解到，学校的法语老师对法语充满热情，但鄙视法国，如果他回来就会面临被捕的危险.

;

;基兰·欧文斯 (Kieran Owens) 于 1966 年至 1974 年间就读于这所学校，他表示，费特伦激发了令人敬畏的恐惧。 “没有人会考虑与弗洛伊滕先生作对。他就像一座随时可能爆发的火山。如果有任何违法行为，他会非常、非常、非常迅速和暴力。我亲眼目睹他殴打一个人；那家伙飞过房间。”

;

;他的教学方法实际上是动手实践。欧文斯说：“如果他试图让你发音一个单词，他会用手将你的下巴塑造成任何需要正确发音的位置。”

;

;尼古拉斯·罗宾逊 (Nicholas Robinson) 在 20 世纪 80 年代师从 Feutren当他身体比较虚弱时——体罚是非法的——但老师仍然害怕学生。 “为了纠正发音，他会在你的舌背上放一把尺子，你必须让它以正确的方式振动。”

;

;另一名 20 世纪 80 年代的学生马克·柯林斯 (Mark Collins) 表示，年龄并没有缓和 Feutren 的暴力倾向。冲动：“他会扭你的耳朵或者打你。”柯林斯回忆说，他被要求站在全班同学面前，脱掉任何他无法用法语说出名字的衣服。 “所以你有一个 13 岁的男孩在想‘我会在这里被剥光衣服吗？’”

;

;“我们习惯了直接的惩罚形式，但对他来说，这只是险恶和奇怪的。他会让你站成一排，嘴里叼着一支粉笔，并确保你的嘴唇没有碰到粉笔。真是奇怪的行为。”

;

;威尔士国家图书馆 ;2011 年因接受 Feutren 遗赠的 30 万英镑;以及文件和录音带而受到批评。

; Wed, 04 Oct 2023 02:22:02 +0800 Ian McEwan criticises hiring of ‘sensitivity readers’ looking for offensive material in manuscriptshttps://www.theguardian.com/books/2023/oct/03/ian-mcewan-criticises-hiring-of-sensitivity-readers-looking-for-offensive-material-in-manuscripts
;;2023-10-03T17:08:16Z;
;
;;Ian McEwan。
;

;Ian McEwan 表示反对敏感性读数，指责年轻人想要“以微不足道的方式捆绑他们的胳膊和腿”。

;

;在巴黎接受法新社国际通讯社采访时，这位布克奖获奖小说家对雇人阅读手稿的做法表示不屑。在出版前指出可能冒犯读者的内容。 “这些大规模的歇斯底里、道德恐慌时不时地席卷人群。我认为这就是其中之一。”他说。

;

;这位 75 岁的老人认为，对敏感读者的支持主要来自“生活在相对自由的社会中的非常年轻人”——但并不是所有年轻人都有这样的观点。他将敏感阅读描述为“在一些大学里发生的一件奇怪的事情，这是我们从美国学来的”。

;

;据报道，他听到一位年轻的男性作家谈论他对写男性欲望的恐惧，他认为： “可怜的家伙！'因为你已经失去了半个世界的欲望。”

;

;他会建议这位作家和其他感到害怕的人写一些可能会冒犯“勇敢”和“去他妈的很多人”的东西。

;

;“你必须写下你的感受。你必须说实话。”他说。

;

;继今年早些时候对罗尔德·达尔和伊恩·弗莱明的作品进行死后修改后，关于此类编辑是否属于审查行为的争论变得越来越突出，一些作者表明了他们在这个问题上的立场。我们需要谈谈凯文（Kevin）的作者莱昂内尔·施莱弗（Lionel Shriver）长期以来一直是敏感读者的反对者，他说;她宁愿放弃写作;也不愿使用它。与此同时，《猜火车》的作者 ;欧文·威尔士 (Irvine Welsh) 表示;，虽然他最初对在 2022 年的小说《长刀》中使用火车持怀疑态度，但以跨性别角色为特色，与他合作的读者“非常出色”，而且这段经历“确实让这本书变得更好”。

;

;在 ;今年早些时候接受《独立报》采访;时，麦克尤恩表示他自己从未使用过敏感性阅读器：“我一直在阅读相关内容，但我似乎逃脱了那种特殊的鞭打。”

;

;乔·拜登的儿子亨特·拜登对这起政治上充满争议的案件中的三项联邦枪支指控表示不认罪，该案件可能会在美国总统 2024 年连任竞选的白热化阶段接受审判。

;

;53岁的亨特·拜登是现任总统第一个受到刑事起诉的孩子，他在特拉华州威尔明顿的一家法院被提审，被指控作为非法吸毒者非法持有枪支，并在背景调查表上谎报自己吸毒的情况当他在 2018 年购买一把柯尔特眼镜蛇左轮手枪时。

;

;

;

;他的律师阿贝·洛厄尔周二告诉法庭，他将提出驳回此案的动议，因为他相信该协议仍然有效。伯克表示，他必须在 11 月 3 日之前提交申请。共和党人声称，该协议对民主党总统的儿子来说是一项“甜心协议”。

;

;司法部尚未表示是否也会对单独的税务轻罪指控提起起诉，但特别检察官已表示他们could come in Washington or in California, where Hunter lives.

;Hunter, who acknowledged past cocaine use ;in his memoir;, held a position in the White House or on his father's campaign. ;Last week Hunter fought back, suing Trump ally Rudy Giuliani and Giuliani's former lawyer Robert Costello, accusing the pair of violating his privacy over data allegedly taken from his laptop.

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 23:52:02 +0800 Ursus rotundus: contenders compete in Alaska’s Fat Bear Weekhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/03/alaska-fat-bear-week-katmai-national-park

;
;;Bear 747, a popular two-time winner, pictured in 2020. 747 is is 'typically very fat' by the end of the week.
;

;Fat Bear Week, the annual competition to see which Alaskan bears can pack on the most pounds before hibernation season, begins this week, with a combination of fan favorites and newcomers vying for the title of the state's most rotund bear.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Two people and their dog killed in rare grizzly bear attack in Canada national park;

;
;

;The contest, which has become increasingly popular in recent years, will see 12 bears in the Katmai national park in Alaska face off against each other, in an online vote.

;

;Among the returning bears is 747, a popular two-time winner who is “typically very fat” by the end of the week, according to ;the Katmai Fat Bear Week guide;. 747, a “skilled and efficient angler” who was once estimated to weigh 1,600lbs (636kg), is among the favorites this year.

;

;Another previous winner is Otis, a three-time champion who is identifiable, according to Katmai, by his “blocky muzzle and a floppy right ear”. An older bear, Otis's fishing hallmark is his “patience and persistence”.

;

;“Like many older bears, Otis must also persevere through the poor condition of his teeth. He is missing two canine teeth and many of his other teeth are greatly worn,” the ;Katmai bear guide; says.

;

;Fat Bear Week works by allowing fans to vote for one of two bears. The victor then moves on to the next round, to face off against a different bear. There will be a daily vote each day from Wednesday to next Tuesday, when the champion will be crowned.

;

;A favorite time of year for fans of fat bears around the world, Fat Bear Week narrowly avoided being canceled when ;a government shutdown was averted; on Sunday. Had the shutdown gone ahead, the park rangers who run the contest would have been furloughed.

;

;Having survived congressional incompetence, fans will be watching eagerly as the titans of Fat Bear Week guzzle down salmon to gain pre-hibernation weight.

;

;The first vote on Wednesday will see 806 Jr, described as a “titanic tank of a spring cub”, face off against 428, a “pudgy three-and-a-half-year-old” female.

;

;806 Jr comes in hot on the tails of winning the Fat Bear Junior competition at the end of September, and will be one to watch.

;

;In Wednesday's second vote, 402 enters the competition after facing tragedy last year, when one of her two young cubs went missing. A “skilled angler” and “efficient scavenger of dead and dying salmon in the lower Brooks River”, 402 has continued to care for her surviving cub.

;

;Organizers will hope to avoid the controversy that briefly tainted last year's tournament.

;

;Katmai rangers said a ballot box had been “stuffed” in favor of a brown bear called Holly, giving her victory over 747 in the contest's semi-finals.

;

;An investigation, however, found that Holly had been propelled to victory after she received 9,000 votes in a short space of time.

;

;Katmai national park conducted a recount, and awarded 747 the victory. ;747 went on to triumph; in the final, and will be hoping to add to his trophy haul this year.

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 23:22:01 +0800 Tree-planting schemes threaten tropical biodiversity, say ecologistshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/oct/03/carbon-tree-planting-schemes-threaten-tropical-biodiversity-aoe
;;2023-10-03T15:00:17Z;
;
;;WWF Ecomakala project managers visit a eucalyptus plantation partly intended to produce charcoal in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in September 2019.
;

;Monoculture tree-planting schemes are threatening tropical biodiversity while only offering modest climate benefit, ecologists have said, warning that ecosystems like the Amazon and Congo basin are being reduced to their carbon value.

;

;Amid a boom in the planting of single-species plantations to capture carbon, scientists have urged governments to prioritise the conservation and restoration of native forests over commercial monocultures, and cautioned that planting swathes of non-native trees in tropical regions threatens important flora and fauna for a negligible climate impact.

;

;Writing in ;the journal Trends in Ecology & Evolution;, ecologists said the increasing popularity of commercial pine, eucalyptus and teak plantations in the tropics for carbon offsetting is having unintended consequences, such as drying out native ecosystems, acidifying soils, crowding out native plants and turbocharging wildfires.

;

;“Despite the broad range of ecosystem functions and services provided by tropical ecosystems, society has reduced the value of these ecosystems to just one metric – carbon,” the paper reads. “It is broadly assumed that maximising standing carbon stocks also benefits biodiversity, ecosystem function and enhances socioeconomic co-benefits – yet this is often not the case.”

;

;Tree-planting has been held up as an important tool in mitigating global heating, with dozens of public and private initiatives under way to rapidly increase forest cover around the world to meet net zero goals. However, research indicates that the environmental benefit is heavily dependent on the scale and type of restoration, and requires huge areas of land. One ;2019 study estimated; that allowing natural forests to regenerate could return 40 times as much carbon as plantations.

;

;Jesús Aguirre-Gutiérrez, an ecologist at the University of Oxford who led the paper, said the scientists decided to say something after witnessing the increase in commercial plantations in the tropics.

; ;

;“We carry out a lot of fieldwork in the tropics to research what is happening with climate change and we have seen the boom in these plantations for ourselves: teaks, conifer and eucalyptus, just one or two species,” he said. “These schemes are a win for the company planting these trees but not for biodiversity. This is the start of this phenomenon, hence the seriousness of the situation.”

;

;The paper estimates that a plantation across the combined size of the US, China, Russia and the UK would have to be planted in order to sequester one year of emissions.

;

;While plantations are often more economically viable than standing forests, the paper highlights that they often support a lower level of biodiversity. For example, in the Brazilian Cerrado savanna, a 40% rise in woodland cover reduced the diversity of plants and ants by about 30%.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Campaigners urge Prince William to rewild Dartmoor farmland;

;
;

;Simon Lewis, a professor of Global Change Science at University College London, said it was dangerous to treat trees as “nothing more than sticks of carbon”.

;

;“Of course, plantations are needed for the paper and wood products society needs, but rebadging industrial plantations as carbon offsets is yet another problem of the … unregulated carbon offsets market. Tree-planting should not be seen as an alternative to rapidly cutting fossil fuel emissions,” he said.

;

;Thomas Crowther, a professor of ecology at ETH Zurich, who ;co-authored a paper; that found there are 900m hectares (2.2bn acres) of land outside urban and agricultural areas suitable for forests, said placing the carbon value of an ecosystem above everything else was wrong.

;

;“Whenever we value one part of nature more than everything else, we incentivise the propagation of that part at the expense of everything else,” he said. “Historically, we have valued the parts that we use for food, timber, medicines etc, but now we are doing the same thing with carbon.”

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 23:22:01 +0800 Iran: activists say 16-year-old girl hospitalised by police over hijab ruleshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/03/iran-activists-say-16-year-old-girl-hospitalised-by-police-over-hijab-rules
;;2023-10-03T15:12:19Z;
;
;;Footage of the incident showing a girl being carried off a train by other girls at a metro station.
;

;The hospitalisation of a 16-year-old girl in Tehran has led to accusations by a rights group and activists that she was beaten into a coma by Iran's feared “morality police”, putting the country back on edge a year after mass protests erupted over the treatment of women.

;

;Footage of the incident showed a girl being carried off a train by other girls at a metro station and placed on the platform, where she stays still, apparently unconscious.

;

;According to Hengaw, an exiled human rights organisation, Armita Garawand ;suffered a “severe physical assault”; by the “morality police” for not complying with national rules on the hijab.

;

;State-run media, which published the edited footage, claimed the girl had instead fainted due to a drop in blood pressure, leading her to hit the side of the train carriage.

;

;The published footage does not show what happened inside the train, only the girl walking on and then being carried out, apparently by her friends. The low quality video does not show clearly what type of head covering, if any, that she was wearing.

;

;The government's official news agency, Fars, ;published an interview; with the girl's parents, in which they say she was not attacked. The father is recorded as saying: “We have checked all the videos and it has been proven for us that this incident was an accident.

;

;“We request people to pray for our child's recovery,” he added.

;

;Iranian authorities have published forced interviews with family members in the past, leading to accusations online that the parents were coerced into speaking.

;

;A journalist from the reformist newspaper Shargh who had been trying to cover the story by going to the hospital was briefly arrested. Access to the hosptial has since been restricted by police.

;

;The incident, and the conflicting explanations, have drawn close parallels to the events that preceded the death of a Kurdish woman, Mahsa Amini, who had been arrested for not complying with hijab rules.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Mahsa Amini and a year of brutality and courage in Iran – in illustrations;

;
;

;Authorities insisted Amini suffered a neurological disorder that led her to collapse inside a police station. Her family never accepted the explanation for her subsequent death in a coma, and said they had been denied the right to choose the doctor to conduct a postmortem.

;

;Since then, Iranian authorities have been trying to re-enforce the compulsory hijab for women including passing new legislation, but in parts of some cities the requirement to wear the hijab is ignored. Security officers often patrol at train stations in Tehran.

;

;Since Amini's death the level of state censorship has risen and two of the journalists that reported on Amini's fate remain in jail, accused of colluding with outside powers. Some reformist newspapers have been closed.

;

;On social media it has been claimed that history is repeating itself and that Iranian officials are now involved in a fabricated story, similar to the alleged cover up after Amini's death. At minimum, the episode underlines the distrust of government officials and state-affiliated media.

;

;The lawyer for Amini, , is in court facing charges for propaganda against the regime, including for challenging the official forensic accounts of her death, and for speaking to local and foreign media about Iran.
